channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for WI
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for WI

item.title: Report E-2025060248
item.description:
Report E-2025060248

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-11
  • City: MILWAUKEE
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 11, 2025, one (1) 5-gallon pail of paint was crushed by a loading strap during transit and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the dock floor, pallet, and surrounding freight. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from EnviroServe (ES) to remediate the site. The crew utilized absorbent pads and cleaning agents to remediate the impacted areas. All impacted materials and the damaged pail were containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.

item.description:
Report X-2025060900

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-06
  • City: OAK CREEK
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: GROUND UNDECLARED PACKAGE WAS FOUND DURING PACKAGE REWRAP AFTER IT WAS LEAKED ON BY ANOTHER PACKAGE. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED A SINGLE INNER FIVE GALLON METAL CAN OF FLAMMABLE GATOR SEAL CONCRETE SEALER. THERE WERE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX TO INDICATE A DANGEROUS GOOD WAS BEING INTRODUCED IN TRANSPORTATION.

item.title: Report E-2025060072
item.description:
Report E-2025060072

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-29
  • City: MILWAUKEE
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On May 29, 2025, one (1) 30-gallon drum of Formula 8410 (UN1814) was damaged by a forklift and released approximately five (5) gallons of product to the trailer's interior, exterior, and the pavement below. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from SET Environmental (SET) to remediate the impacted site. SET personnel utilized neutralizing agents and absorbent pads to remediate the impacted trailer. The crew used granular absorbents for the impacted pavement. All impacted media and absorbents were containerized in one (1) 35-gallon drum. The damaged 30-gallon drum of product was placed in one (1) 55-gallon drum, which was then containerized in one (1) 95-gallon overpack drum.

item.title: Report E-2025050564
item.description:
Report E-2025050564

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-21
  • City: HUDSON
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately one (1) gallon of material released from one (1) 55-gallon metal drum due to a nail resulting in the metal drum being punctured. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and gathered the spent material and containerized it into one (1) 95-gallon poly drum along with PPE. The damaged drum with product was placed into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freightâ€™s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report X-2025051676
item.description:
Report X-2025051676

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-09
  • City: OAK CREEK
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER FOUND ENVELOPE WITH TORN EDGE CONTAINING THE CANS OF SUNSCREEN. ONE CAN WAS POKING OUT OF THE TORN ENVELOPE AND THE CAP WAS CRACKED. THERE WAS NO LIQUID RESIDUE SO IT APPEARED NO RELEASE OF PRODUCT. BUT RESPONDER NOTICED THERE WASN'T A LIMITED QUANTITY DIAMOND ON THE ENVELOPE FOR THE AEROSOL CAN INSIDE. RMP WAS NOTIFIED. SHE TOOK PICTURES OF THE PACKAGE AND CONTENTS.

item.title: Report X-2025060753
item.description:
Report X-2025060753

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-07
  • City: STEVENS POINT
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: Wisconsin Central Railroad Ltd.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 34000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On May 07, 2025, A CN Mechanical employee observed liquid dripping from the bottom discharge cap of covered hopper car # SHPX432827 while performing rail car inspections on an outbound train at the Cn Stevens Point Wi. yard. The employee notified the on-duty transportation manager who in turn made all internal notifications to initiate a response to the incident. A CN emergency response contractor was dispatched to the location for inspection/ mitigation hopper car SHPX432827 (R) Last Contained Sodium Chlorate UN 1495, Class 5.1//PG II The CN contractor found the bottom discharge cap dripping product. The car was isolated for further investigation. The CN contractor secured the track by applying blue flag protection. The car was opened for internal inspection and found that the shipper failed to get all the liquid slurry removed, as well the camlock cap was not secured properly for shipment. The security seals were removed from the top hatch on SHPX432827 where the contractor noticed the liquid and product in the B end compartment, which was leaking out the bottom discharge. We will be solidifying the remaining product and off load the product into a highway container for disposal
